00:00:15:180000.Speaker: Penny
00:00:15:180000.Dialogue: Okay, help me out here. How does an archeology professor get that good with a whip?

00:00:20:200000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:20:200000.Dialogue: Maybe he took a class at the adult bookstore. That's how I learned.

00:00:25:010000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:25:010000.Dialogue: I can't believe you've never seen Raiders of the Lost Ark.

00:00:27:200000.Speaker: Penny
00:00:27:200000.Dialogue: And I can't believe you've never read Eat, Pray, Love.

00:00:31:160000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:31:160000.Dialogue: When she comes out with Eat, Pray, Run Away From A Giant Boulder, I'll read it.

00:00:37:090000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:37:090000.Dialogue: I don't care if Eat, Pray, Love changed your life, I'm not reading it.

00:00:43:190000.Speaker: Penny
00:00:43:190000.Dialogue: You know, I could totally rock a hat like that.

00:00:46:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:46:020000.Dialogue: That's the work of noted Hollywood costume designer Deborah Nadoolman. She also designed the iconic red and black jacket in Michael Jackson's Thriller video, which I've never viewed in its entirety, as I find zombies dancing in choreographed synchronicity implausible.

00:01:04:140000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:04:140000.Dialogue: Would someone please turn off the Sheldon commentary track?

00:01:07:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:07:170000.Dialogue: There's no switch. Just listen and learn.

00:01:12:110000.Speaker: Howard
00:01:12:110000.Dialogue: Penny, if you think this is good, you should come with us Friday to see it on the big screen at the Colonial.

00:01:17:100000.Speaker: Penny
00:01:17:100000.Dialogue: Well, I'm watching it now. Why would I want to see it again on Friday?

00:01:19:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:19:230000.Dialogue: Because the print they're showing on Friday has an additional 21 seconds of previously unseen footage.

00:01:26:050000.Speaker: Penny
00:01:26:050000.Dialogue: 21 seconds? That'll be like seeing a whole new movie!

00:01:30:210000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:30:210000.Dialogue: Exactly. They say it finally solves the submarine controversy.

00:01:33:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:33:230000.Dialogue: Did-- Leonard? I'm no expert, but I believe what we just heard from Penny was sarcasm. Oh! Good. I'm eight for 26 this month.

00:01:45:230000.Speaker: Penny
00:01:45:230000.Dialogue: Yeah, I think I'll pass. But you guys enjoy your extra 21 seconds.

00:01:49:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:49:220000.Dialogue: Bet if I could make you understand why this is such a cool thing, we'd still be together.

00:01:57:060000.Speaker: Howard
00:01:57:060000.Dialogue: Uh-huh. I'm guessing 21 seconds had something to do with that, too.

00:02:32:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:32:160000.Dialogue: May I point out to you all that the screening is "first come, first served"?

00:02:36:120000.Speaker: Leonard
00:02:36:120000.Dialogue: Relax, it's 5:00. The movie doesn't start till midnight.

00:02:40:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:40:020000.Dialogue: Another way of saying that is the movie starts at midnight, and it's already 5:00. Let's go.

00:02:45:200000.Speaker: Howard
00:02:45:200000.Dialogue: You know, if we miss it, we'll have the fun of listening to Sheldon whine about it for the rest of our lives.

00:02:54:070000.Speaker: Howard
00:02:54:070000.Dialogue: Actually, I'm not. I'm using sarcasm to mock you.

00:03:01:190000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:01:190000.Dialogue: Don't worry, Sheldon. We'll be fine.

00:03:03:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:03:180000.Dialogue: What happened to the Leonard Hofstadter who waited in line with me for 14 hours to see the midnight premiere of Star Trek: Nemesis?

00:03:10:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:10:100000.Dialogue: Oh. Well, he waited in line for 14 hours, while you napped in a lawn chair, he got in a fight with a Klingon when he stepped out of line to pee and you wouldn't wake up to vouch for him, and worst of all, he saw Star Trek: Nemesis.

00:03:26:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:26:130000.Dialogue: I rest my case. Amy, don't you agree we should leave now and get in line?

00:03:32:210000.Speaker: Amy
00:03:32:210000.Dialogue: Actually, as the newest member of your social group, I believe I'll gain more acceptance by arbitrarily siding with your friends from time to time.

00:03:42:210000.Speaker: Amy
00:03:42:210000.Dialogue: Leonard, you're right. We should enjoy our meal, arrive late, and risk winding up with terrible seats, assuming we get in at all.

00:04:03:110000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:03:110000.Dialogue: Guys, that's really starting to get old.

00:04:08:010000.Speaker: Howard
00:04:08:010000.Dialogue: I have a girlfriend and you don't.

00:04:12:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:12:230000.Dialogue: Wait, now, we don't know that yet. He isn't finished. I have a girlfriend and you don't who?

00:04:17:230000.Speaker: Howard
00:04:17:230000.Dialogue: So. Are you sure you don't want to come with us to Raiders?

00:04:22:030000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:04:22:030000.Dialogue: Oh, no. That movie has melting faces. It reminds me too much of the time I dropped that vial of flesh-eating bacteria into the Rhesus monkey lab.

00:04:32:210000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:04:32:210000.Dialogue: Besides, Penny and I are having a girls' night tonight.

00:04:35:050000.Speaker: Amy
00:04:35:050000.Dialogue: Girls' night? What does that entail?

00:04:37:090000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:04:37:090000.Dialogue: Oh, you know, girls get together, hang out, share girl talk.

00:04:43:140000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:04:43:140000.Dialogue: Oh. Well, maybe you can join us. I'll ask Penny.

00:04:48:020000.Speaker: Amy
00:04:48:020000.Dialogue: No need. Penny and I are very close.

00:04:52:170000.Speaker: Amy
00:04:52:170000.Dialogue: Yes. In fact, our menses are synchronized.

00:05:00:160000.Speaker: Amy
00:05:00:160000.Dialogue: Penny. Bernadette tells me you're planning a girls' night.

00:05:08:040000.Speaker: Penny
00:05:08:040000.Dialogue: Oh. Um, it was-- it was just going to be me and Bernadette. Besides, I thought you were going to the movies with Sheldon and the guys.

00:05:13:200000.Speaker: Amy
00:05:13:200000.Dialogue: Yes, but they're not girls. I'm a girl.

00:05:17:060000.Speaker: Penny
00:05:17:060000.Dialogue: Yeah, no, no, I-I-I got that.

00:05:24:210000.Speaker: Amy
00:05:24:210000.Dialogue: All right. I'll have to go shopping.

00:05:34:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:34:070000.Dialogue: Hugh people need to listen to me.

00:05:41:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:41:080000.Dialogue: It's time to get in line for the movie. And that's how you tell a knock-knock joke.

00:05:50:030000.Scene: The movie theatre. The line is incredibly long.
00:05:50:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:50:030000.Dialogue: Under normal circumstances I'd say, "I told you so." But as I have told you so with such vehemence and frequency already, the phrase has lost all meaning. Therefore, I will be replacing it with the phrase: I informed you thusly.

00:06:07:150000.Scene: The movie theatre. The line is incredibly long.
00:06:07:150000.Speaker: Howard
00:06:07:150000.Dialogue: Ooh. Can't wait for that to start.

00:06:10:120000.Scene: The movie theatre. The line is incredibly long.
00:06:10:120000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:06:12:190000.Scene: The movie theatre. The line is incredibly long.
00:06:12:190000.Speaker: Raj

00:06:16:090000.Scene: The movie theatre. The line is incredibly long.
00:06:16:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:16:090000.Dialogue: This is where we could have been if we hadn't stopped for dinner. This is where we could have been if Koothrappali hadn't ordered dessert.

00:06:24:150000.Scene: The movie theatre. The line is incredibly long.
00:06:24:150000.Speaker: Raj
00:06:24:150000.Dialogue: Well I earned it, dude, I ate all my broccoli.

00:06:26:190000.Scene: The movie theatre. The line is incredibly long.
00:06:26:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:26:190000.Dialogue: And here's where we are. The runts in a large litter. unlikely to ever reach the nourishing teats of Indiana Jones.

00:06:37:160000.Scene: The movie theatre. The line is incredibly long.
00:06:37:160000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:37:160000.Dialogue: So I guess it's a good thing we stopped for dinner.

00:06:42:220000.Speaker: Raj
00:06:42:220000.Dialogue: You know, guys, when facing disappointment, Eat, Pray, Love  teaches us--

00:06:50:170000.Speaker: Amy
00:06:50:170000.Dialogue: ...so anyway, to make a long story short, turns out I have an unusually firm cervix.

00:06:58:190000.Speaker: Penny
00:06:58:190000.Dialogue: You-- Amy, when we say "girl talk," it doesn't just have to be about our lady parts.

00:07:05:190000.Speaker: Amy
00:07:05:190000.Dialogue: Shame. 'Cause I have a real zinger about my titled uterus.

00:07:17:200000.Speaker: Penny
00:07:17:200000.Dialogue: Oh, thanks. I found this place in Alhambra. It's in a woman's basement. I think it's a front for human trafficking, but they do a really good job.

00:07:28:100000.Speaker: Amy
00:07:28:100000.Dialogue: A colleague of mine did her graduate thesis on the fungus that grows on improperly sterilized manicure implements.

00:07:34:170000.Speaker: Amy
00:07:34:170000.Dialogue: Well don't tell me that's not "girl talk."

00:07:37:140000.Speaker: Penny
00:07:37:140000.Dialogue: So where should we go tonight? A bar? A club? A movie?

00:07:42:170000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:07:42:170000.Dialogue: Or we could just stay here.

00:07:44:090000.Speaker: Amy
00:07:44:090000.Dialogue: Yes, and continue to bond. I have a feeling that after tonight, one of you will become my best friend forever. Or "BFF," if you prefer. Which I don't.

00:07:54:130000.Speaker: Penny
00:07:54:130000.Dialogue: All right, time to open Bachelor Number Two.

00:07:58:190000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:07:58:190000.Dialogue: Gee, I don't know if I should drink more. I have to drive home, and I've got enough trouble seeing over the dashboard as it is.

00:08:06:040000.Speaker: Penny
00:08:06:040000.Dialogue: That's okay. You can just sleep here.

00:08:09:110000.Speaker: Amy
00:08:09:110000.Dialogue: Oh, good, a slumber party! We'll do makeovers, initiate phony phone calls, and have spirited pillow fights in our frilly nighties!

00:08:17:040000.Speaker: Penny
00:08:17:040000.Dialogue: Oh, gosh, Amy. I don't know if I would call this an actual slumber party.

00:08:21:040000.Speaker: Amy
00:08:21:040000.Dialogue: Well, that's disappointing. I've always wanted to be invited to a slumber party.

00:08:25:180000.Speaker: Penny
00:08:25:180000.Dialogue: Not even when you were a kid?

00:08:27:050000.Speaker: Amy
00:08:27:050000.Dialogue: Well, there was the time I had my tonsils out, and I shared a room with a little Vietnamese girl.

00:08:33:160000.Speaker: Amy
00:08:33:160000.Dialogue: She didn't make it through the night, but up till then, it was kind of fun.

00:08:39:200000.Speaker: Penny
00:08:39:200000.Dialogue: Okay. Well, I guess we're having a slumber party. Oh!

00:08:50:190000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:50:190000.Dialogue: Oh, I hope they let us in soon. I'm tired of running to the gas station to use the bathroom. The guy makes me buy a Gatorade every time. It's a vicious circle.

00:09:00:120000.Speaker: Howard
00:09:00:120000.Dialogue: Too bad you don't have a stadium pal like me.

00:09:05:220000.Speaker: Howard
00:09:05:220000.Dialogue: Let me put it this way: takes care of the bathroom problem, and it keeps your calf warm.

00:09:12:060000.Speaker: Raj
00:09:12:060000.Dialogue: Hey, guys, bad news. I just did a quick calculation. Given the size of the theater and the length of this line, we might not get seats.

00:09:22:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:22:230000.Dialogue: Nice going, Raj. Just got him down for his nap.

00:09:29:110000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:29:110000.Dialogue: It's fine, it's fine. Go back to sleep.

00:09:30:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:30:190000.Dialogue: Oh, I informed you thusly! I so informed you thusly.

00:09:34:120000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:34:120000.Dialogue: Howard, you talk to him. Howard? You're peeing, aren't you?

00:09:44:050000.Speaker: Wil Wheaton
00:09:44:050000.Dialogue: Hey, look who's here! Hey, buddies!

00:09:47:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:47:060000.Dialogue: Well, if it isn't Wil Wheaton, the Jar Jar Binks of the Star Trek universe.

00:09:56:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:56:130000.Dialogue: Well, you-sa can go think that at the back of the line. No cuts, no buts, no coconuts.

00:10:10:160000.Speaker: Wil
00:10:10:160000.Dialogue: Do you think you could get me and my friends into the movie? We got here a little late.

00:10:13:230000.Speaker: Theatre Staff
00:10:13:230000.Dialogue: No problem. Come on, I'll hook you up.

00:10:18:080000.Speaker: Wil
00:10:18:080000.Dialogue: We-sa gonna go into the movie now! Bye-bye!

00:10:23:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:23:210000.Dialogue: This is Indiana Jones, not Star Trek. There should be no value to his pseudo-celebrity here! And even at Star Trek conventions, they only let him in if he helps set up!

00:10:37:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:37:130000.Dialogue: I will not calm down. This affront to justice and decency cannot go unanswered. As Captain Jean-Luc Picard once said, The line must be drawn here! This far, no farther!"

00:10:52:000000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:52:000000.Dialogue: Had to wake him up from his nap, didn't you?

00:10:58:180000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:10:58:180000.Dialogue: You know what I really love about Howard? His chest hair.

00:11:13:180000.Speaker: Penny
00:11:13:180000.Dialogue: Okay, there you go-- Sultry Sunrise Red. What do you think?

00:11:18:140000.Speaker: amy
00:11:18:140000.Dialogue: My nails have never looked so pretty before.

00:11:25:180000.Speaker: Raj
00:11:25:180000.Dialogue: Oh, oh, uh, looks like they're getting ready to let people in.

00:11:28:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:28:140000.Dialogue: Listen to what Mr. Wil Wheaton is tweeting. Best seats in house for Raiders screening. Suck on that, Sheldon Cooper.

00:11:38:160000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:38:160000.Dialogue: Why do you read his Twitter feed? You know it's only going to upset you.

00:11:42:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:42:060000.Dialogue: I believe in knowing my enemy, Leonard. Had Twitter existed at the time, would not General Custer have followed the tweets of Sitting Bull? Would not Lee have followed Grant? Would not Spy have followed Spy?

00:11:56:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:56:160000.Dialogue: I have more examples, but excuse me. Hello. Well, this seems like an odd time to test my cell phone quality, but go on. Test phrases? All right. Imatote. Ulba. Twad.

00:12:16:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:16:100000.Dialogue: All together? I'm a total buttwad.

00:12:28:090000.Speaker: Penny
00:12:28:090000.Dialogue: And that, girls, is how you make a phony phone call.

00:12:32:220000.Speaker: Amy
00:12:32:220000.Dialogue: I'm not sure I grasp the full entertainment value, but all right. Next on Wikipedia's list of slumber party activities: Truth or Dare.

00:12:41:120000.Speaker: Penny
00:12:41:120000.Dialogue: Okay, it's your game. You go first.

00:12:43:040000.Speaker: Amy
00:12:43:040000.Dialogue: Hang on. I'm familiarizing myself with the rules. Seems fairly straightforward. Bernadette, truth or dare?

00:12:53:040000.Speaker: Amy
00:12:53:040000.Dialogue: To what temperature must you heat beef in order to kill the prion that causes bovine spongiform encephalopathy?

00:13:01:130000.Speaker: Amy
00:13:01:130000.Dialogue: Remember, you have to answer honestly.

00:13:04:060000.Speaker: Penny
00:13:04:060000.Dialogue: Wait. No, Amy, you're supposed to ask her something personal or embarrassing.

00:13:07:220000.Speaker: Amy
00:13:07:220000.Dialogue: Oh. All right. What is the circumference of your areolas?

00:13:19:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:19:190000.Dialogue: Munching on complimentary popcorn. Woot, woot. Oh, the gall. I hope his next tweet is "Popcorn lodged in trachea. Choking to death. Woot, woot.

00:13:34:030000.Speaker: Theatre Staff
00:13:34:030000.Dialogue: Guys, I am sorry. We are full up.

00:13:39:050000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:39:050000.Dialogue: We really want to see this. Isn't there anything you can do?

00:13:42:230000.Speaker: Theatre Staff
00:13:42:230000.Dialogue: Sorry. Fire regulations. Should've gotten here earlier.

00:13:45:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:45:010000.Dialogue: This is nothing but a blatant abuse of power by a petty functionary. Explain to me why Wil Wheaton and his lackeys get in and we don't.

00:13:53:170000.Speaker: Theatre Staff
00:13:53:170000.Dialogue: Cause I'm the petty functionary with a clipboard, bitch.

00:13:59:210000.Speaker: Howard
00:13:59:210000.Dialogue: I guess that's that. Let's go home.

00:14:04:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:04:050000.Dialogue: You know what? I'm going back to "I told you so." I told you so.

00:14:09:090000.Speaker: Raj
00:14:09:090000.Dialogue: We can still see something. Oh, the new Sandra Bullock movie is playing two blocks away. You know Sandy B. always brings it.

00:14:15:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:15:230000.Dialogue: Look-- a side door. Come on, Short Round.

00:14:21:040000.Speaker: Howard
00:14:21:040000.Dialogue: I guess we'd better go after him.

00:14:24:100000.Speaker: Raj
00:14:24:100000.Dialogue: Indy's young sidekick from Temple of Doom.

00:14:26:030000.Speaker: Leonard
00:14:26:030000.Dialogue: Yeah, I know who it is, but why is it me?

00:14:28:160000.Speaker: Raj
00:14:28:160000.Dialogue: You're right. It should be a cuddly Asian boy. Like me.

00:14:34:050000.Speaker: Amy
00:14:34:050000.Dialogue: And Absolon hath kist hir nether ye, and Nicholas is scalded in the towte. This tale is doon, and God save al the rowte."

00:14:48:230000.Speaker: Amy
00:14:48:230000.Dialogue: Bernadette dared me to tell a dirty story. The Miller's Tale by Chaucer is the dirtiest story I know.

00:14:56:120000.Speaker: Amy
00:14:56:120000.Dialogue: It would have been hidden in sock drawers if people in the 14th century had worn socks.

00:15:01:200000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:15:01:200000.Dialogue: I thought it was pretty spicy. Especially the part where he kisses her nether ye.

00:15:08:040000.Speaker: Amy
00:15:08:040000.Dialogue: You might not like it as much if you knew what "nether ye" meant. if one cares about hygiene, one ought not be kissing it.

00:15:17:110000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:15:17:110000.Dialogue: Okay, my turn. Penny, truth or dare?

00:15:21:200000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:15:21:200000.Dialogue: Why are you still hanging out with Leonard so much even though you broke up with him?

00:15:25:160000.Speaker: Amy
00:15:25:160000.Dialogue: Oh, that's an excellent question. For two people who claim to be no longer pair-bonded, you spend an inordinate amount of time in each other's company.

00:15:40:040000.Speaker: Amy
00:15:40:040000.Dialogue: I don't believe the rules allow for an ex post facto option change.

00:15:46:210000.Speaker: Penny
00:15:46:210000.Dialogue: Okay, look, just because we're not seeing each other anymore doesn't mean we can't be friends. I mean, Leonard's a great guy.

00:15:53:020000.Speaker: Amy
00:15:53:020000.Dialogue: Then, why did you terminate your relationship with him?

00:15:55:070000.Speaker: Penny
00:15:55:070000.Dialogue: I don't know. He got really serious, and I wasn't ready for it.

00:15:59:120000.Speaker: Amy
00:15:59:120000.Dialogue: Interesting. How will you react if, in the future, you become ready for it, and Leonard is unavailable, because another woman has realized that he is-- to use your words-- "a great guy"?

00:16:10:230000.Speaker: Penny
00:16:10:230000.Dialogue: You can only ask one question.

00:16:17:230000.Speaker: Penny
00:16:17:230000.Dialogue: You know what, I don't want to play anymore.

00:16:27:030000.Speaker: Amy
00:16:27:030000.Dialogue: Well, I'm not sure how this is scored, but I believe we may have won.

00:16:39:200000.Speaker: Howard
00:16:39:200000.Dialogue: Where did he go? We're looking for Sheldon, not Marmaduke.

00:16:52:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:52:170000.Dialogue: Raiders of the Lost Ark with 21 additional seconds.

00:16:57:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:57:180000.Dialogue: If I can't see it, no one else can see it.

00:17:02:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:02:040000.Dialogue: No. Crazy was leaving the projection booth unattended.

00:17:05:210000.Speaker: Leonard
00:17:05:210000.Dialogue: Listen to me. You are over-tired. You're not thinking right. Put the movie back before we get into trouble.

00:17:11:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:11:040000.Dialogue: Trouble is my middle name, Leonard. Actually, it's Lee, but I prefer Trouble.

00:17:16:010000.Speaker: Wil Wheaton
00:17:16:010000.Dialogue: Oh, look who they let in.

00:17:19:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:19:130000.Dialogue: Don't worry, Wil Wheaton. I was just leaving.

00:17:34:040000.Speaker: Raj
00:17:34:040000.Dialogue: Come on, guys! Hurry up! Hurry up!

00:17:36:100000.Speaker: Howard
00:17:36:100000.Dialogue: Let's see you run with a bag of urine strapped to your leg.

00:17:39:230000.Speaker: Wil
00:17:39:230000.Dialogue: He's got the movie! Get him!

00:17:48:000000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:48:000000.Dialogue: Why is there never a pontoon plane when you need one?

00:18:03:010000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:18:03:010000.Dialogue: She's been in there a long time.

00:18:05:010000.Speaker: Amy
00:18:05:010000.Dialogue: Clearly, losing Truth or Dare upset her. Perhaps we should try to take her mind off it with another popular slumber party activity.

00:18:22:080000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:18:22:080000.Dialogue: Where exactly on the Internet have you been looking?

00:18:35:070000.Speaker: Amy
00:18:35:070000.Dialogue: Don't worry. I'll avoid the nether ye.

00:18:38:180000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:18:38:180000.Dialogue: I might have gone with eating raw cookie dough.
